Bottleneck Explainer: Rhodium is extremely rare and only produced as a byproduct of platinum/palladium mining. The U.S. yields under 1 t (from Montana); virtually all rhodium is imported from South Africa. Its supply is constrained by the output of primary PGM mines overseas, making availability tenuous.
Key Discovery Technologies: Airborne geophysics; geochemical sampling; core drilling; seismic imaging
Key Extraction Technologies: Froth flotation; pyrometallurgical smelting; pressure oxidation; bioleaching trials
Key Separation Technologies: Solvent extraction; ion exchange resins; selective precipitation; molecular recognition
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Calcination; zone refining; plasma melting; chemical vapor transport
Key Remediation Technologies: Paste backfill; lime neutralization; constructed wetlands; sulfate-reducing bioreactors
Bottleneck: Geological scarcity; no major domestic PGM deposits; complex separation chemistry

Bottleneck Explainer: The U.S. is fully import dependent on niobium (mostly from Brazil). There are no U.S. niobium mines; a planned Nebraska project is not yet producing. Relying on a single Brazilian supplier (CBMM) for ferroniobium is a major bottleneck and risk.
Key Discovery Technologies: Carbonatite targeting; aeromagnetic surveys; geochemical sampling; hyperspectral imaging
Key Extraction Technologies: Open-pit/underground mining; crushing-grinding circuits; gravity separation; froth flotation
Key Separation Technologies: Alkaline roasting; acid leaching; solvent extraction; oxide precipitation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Ferroniobium smelting; aluminothermic reduction; electron-beam melting; recycling
Key Remediation Technologies: Ballasted flocculation; tailings management; water recycling; dust control
Bottleneck: Lack of primary mining and ferroniobium processing capacity

Bottleneck Explainer: Samarium is present in U.S. rare earth ore, but there is no domestic separation for mid-range rare earths like Sm. All samarium must be recovered overseas (primarily China). Thus the bottleneck is the lack of U.S. capability to extract Sm from mined rare earth concentrates.
Key Discovery Technologies: Radiometric surveys; hyperspectral imaging; geochemical sampling; geophysical integration; machine learning
Key Extraction Technologies: Open-pit mining; physical beneficiation; flotation; hydrometallurgy; biohydrometallurgy; tailings reprocessing
Key Separation Technologies: Solvent extraction; ion exchange; membrane separation; crystallization; molten salt electrolysis
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Metallothermic reduction; electrorefining; zone refining; chemical purification; vacuum sublimation
Key Remediation Technologies: Tailings stabilization; acid drainage treatment; phytoremediation; in-situ stabilization; recycling
Bottleneck: Solvent extraction separation capacity; metal/alloy production; magnet manufacturing

Bottleneck Explainer: U.S. remains >90% import reliant (mainly Canada); limited domestic expansion by 2030. https://pubs.usgs.gov/periodicals/mcs2024/mcs2024-potash.pdf
Key Discovery Technologies: 3D/4D seismic imaging; gamma-ray logging; gravity surveys; electromagnetic methods
Key Extraction Technologies: conventional underground mining; solution mining; solar evaporation; selective mining
Key Separation Technologies: froth flotation; crystallization; heavy media separation; magnetic separation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: compaction/granulation; Mannheim process; crystallization; drying/screening
Key Remediation Technologies: tailings management; brine treatment; mine closure; water recycling
Bottleneck: screening/classification equipment; brine management systems; environmental compliance infrastructure

Bottleneck Explainer: Lutetium, one of the scarcest rare earths, has no U.S. source. It is only produced in tiny quantities from Chinese ion-adsorption clays. The absolute reliance on Chinese HREE production is the bottleneck for Lu supply.
Key Discovery Technologies: Radiometric surveys; hyperspectral imaging; geochemical sampling; gravity/magnetic surveys
Key Extraction Technologies: Gravity/magnetic separation; flotation; acid leaching; ore sorting; ion adsorption
Key Separation Technologies: Solvent extraction cascades; ion exchange; fractional precipitation; membrane separation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Metallothermic reduction; zone refining; crystal growth; vacuum distillation
Key Remediation Technologies: Tailings neutralization; radioactive waste management; water treatment; site rehabilitation
Bottleneck: Solvent extraction separation capacity; heavy REE refining infrastructure

Bottleneck Explainer: Terbium (for high-performance magnets/phosphors) is not produced outside China. The U.S. has no Tb output and depends entirely on Chinese ion-adsorption clay production. This single-country source for Tb is the bottleneck for any U.S. demand.
Key Discovery Technologies: Radiometric surveys; hyperspectral imaging; ionic clay detection; geochemical sampling
Key Extraction Technologies: Beneficiation; acid leaching; ion-exchange for clays; gravity/magnetic separation
Key Separation Technologies: Solvent extraction; ion-exchange chromatography; fractional crystallization; membrane separation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Oxide precipitation; molten salt electrolysis; metallothermic reduction; zone refining
Key Remediation Technologies: Neutralization; precipitation; wetlands; tailings reprocessing; water treatment
Bottleneck: Heavy-REE separation capacity; metallurgical refinement; low ore grades

Bottleneck Explainer: No dysprosium is mined in the U.S. Heavy rare earth element (HREE) supply is dominated by Chinese ionic clay deposits. The U.S. is fully import reliant for Dy, so any disruption in China’s output directly creates shortages.
Key Discovery Technologies: Airborne geophysics; geochemical sampling; hyperspectral imaging; systematic drilling
Key Extraction Technologies: Open-pit mining; flotation concentration; gravity/magnetic separation; acid leaching; dry-stack tailings
Key Separation Technologies: Solvent extraction; ion exchange; chromatography; crystallization; emerging ionic liquids
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Molten salt electrolysis; metallothermic reduction; vacuum distillation; zone refining; magnet alloying
Key Remediation Technologies: Dry-stack tailings; water recycling; neutralization; reagent recovery; engineered barriers
Bottleneck: Heavy-REE separation and refining infrastructure

Bottleneck Explainer: Domestic aluminum production is far below demand, requiring imports of both alumina and primary metal. The U.S. has limited bauxite ore and refining, relying on foreign alumina (notably from China/Russia). High energy costs and constrained refining capacity create supply bottlenecks.
Key Discovery Technologies: Hyperspectral imaging; geochemical mapping; airborne geophysics; machine learning prospectivity
Key Extraction Technologies: Strip mining; Bayer process; pressure digestion; red mud management
Key Separation Technologies: Gravity settling; pressure filtration; hydrocyclone classification; eddy current sorting
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Hall-Héroult electrolysis; continuous casting; melt treatment; alloy adjustment
Key Remediation Technologies: Alkalinity neutralization; beneficial reuse; spent potliner treatment; emission controls
Bottleneck: Carbon anode dependency; alumina import reliance; energy infrastructure constraints

Bottleneck Explainer: The U.S. has no primary gallium production and is completely import dependent. Gallium is only recovered as a byproduct of aluminum/zinc refining, mostly in China. China’s export restrictions on Ga highlight this bottleneck in the U.S. semiconductor supply chain.
Key Discovery Technologies: XRF/ICP-MS bauxite assays; red mud characterization; zinc ore trace analysis; coal ash screening
Key Extraction Technologies: Bayer liquor ion-exchange; chelating resin columns; acid leaching of residues; mercury-free electrowinning
Key Separation Technologies: Multi-stage solvent extraction; selective precipitation; chelating resins; membrane separation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Zone refining to 7N-8N; vacuum distillation; crystallization; electrolytic polishing
Key Remediation Technologies: Red mud valorization; acid neutralization; metal recovery circuits; e-waste processing
Bottleneck: Ion-exchange/solvent extraction retrofits at alumina refineries; lack of operational Ga recovery infrastructure

Bottleneck Explainer: Ruthenium is another minor PGM produced only as a byproduct in South African/Russian mines. U.S. output is negligible (~0.2 t), so >95% is imported. The supply bottleneck is dependence on foreign PGM operations for any ruthenium, leaving the U.S. exposed to external supply disruptions.
Key Discovery Technologies: airborne geophysics; geochemical sampling; core drilling; structural mapping
Key Extraction Technologies: underground mining; open-pit mining; ore comminution; materials handling
Key Separation Technologies: froth flotation; gravity concentration; magnetic separation; pressure oxidation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: smelting; converting; hydrometallurgical refining; chemical precipitation
Key Remediation Technologies: water treatment; waste recycling; tailings management; site rehabilitation
Bottleneck: PGM refining capacity; hydrometallurgical separation; exploration funding

Bottleneck Explainer: Iridium is extremely scarce and only produced as a minor byproduct of platinum mining. The U.S. (Stillwater) yields only ~0.1 t, so >95% must be imported. Global Ir supply is dominated by South Africa and Russia, so U.S. availability is constrained by those sources.
Key Discovery Technologies: Airborne geophysics for mafic intrusions; IP/EM for sulfides; hyperspectral for alteration; stream sediment PGE assays
Key Extraction Technologies: Flotation concentration; flash smelting to matte; pressure oxidation; chlorination leaching; electrorefining
Key Separation Technologies: Selective precipitation as (NH₄)₂IrCl₆; solvent extraction with amines; ion-exchange on strong-base resins; distillation of OsO₄
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Arc melting at 2450°C; electron-beam melting; zone refining; powder metallurgy; spark-plasma sintering
Key Remediation Technologies: Lime neutralization of acids; SO₂ scrubbing to H₂SO₄; closed-loop PGM recovery; membrane filtration; zero liquid discharge
Bottleneck: Catalyst thrifting to <80 kg/GW; 95%+ recycling efficiency; membrane electrode assembly recovery

Bottleneck Explainer: Like palladium, U.S. platinum is only mined at the Stillwater complex (~4 t), far below domestic use. The U.S. depends on South African and Russian supply for most platinum. This heavy import reliance, combined with the single domestic PGM mine, is the key bottleneck in platinum supply.
Key Discovery Technologies: same as PGE reefs
Key Extraction Technologies: UG conventional stoping
Key Separation Technologies: flotation; gravity PGE
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: pressure leach; solvent extraction
Key Remediation Technologies: tailings thickening; cyanide detox
Bottleneck: Foreign PGM concentration

Bottleneck Explainer: U.S. palladium output (~14 t) comes only from one Montana mine, covering ~70% of domestic needs. The rest is imported, mainly from South Africa and Russia. With Stillwater as the only U.S. source, any disruption shifts reliance entirely to foreign palladium, a significant supply risk.
Key Discovery Technologies: Geochemical sampling of ultramafic intrusions; airborne EM/magnetics; drill core XRF analysis
Key Extraction Technologies: Open-pit/underground mining; SAG/ball mill grinding; froth flotation; matte smelting
Key Separation Technologies: Acid leaching; solvent extraction with organophosphorus reagents; ion exchange; chemical precipitation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Aqua regia dissolution; electrorefining; zone refining; hydrogen reduction
Key Remediation Technologies: Carbon mineralization of ultramafic tailings; sulfate-reducing bioreactors; alkaline neutralization; phytoremediation
Bottleneck: Lack of domestic PGM refining infrastructure; dependence on foreign processing

Bottleneck Explainer: While the U.S. mines ilmenite mineral, it lacks sufficient domestic titanium sponge production. Over 95% of titanium metal used is imported. High capital cost and environmental issues have hindered new sponge plants, leaving U.S. aerospace and defense supply chains dependent on foreign titanium.
Key Discovery Technologies: radiometric surveys; aeromagnetic/gravity; geological mapping; drone hyperspectral; diamond drilling
Key Extraction Technologies: open-pit/dredge mining; wet concentration spirals; dewatering; SAG grinding; magnetic separation
Key Separation Technologies: dense media separation; gravity spirals; magnetic separation; froth flotation; hydraulic washing
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: sulfate/chloride TiO₂ processes; Kroll process; emerging FFC/hydrogenation; VAR melting; electrorefining
Key Remediation Technologies: acid waste neutralization; sulfate mineral reuse; tailings rehabilitation; dust/fume treatment; slag recycling
Bottleneck: Kroll process for titanium sponge production; vacuum distillation; VAR melting

Bottleneck Explainer: U.S. barite production is modest (only ~25% of demand), forcing reliance on high-density imported barite. Limited domestic high-SG deposits and cheaper Chinese/Mexican sources create a supply bottleneck.
Key Discovery Technologies: geochemical sampling; gravity surveys; electrical resistivity; core drilling; hyperspectral imaging
Key Extraction Technologies: open-pit mining; underground stoping; controlled blasting; dense-media handling
Key Separation Technologies: jaw/cone crushing; ball milling; jigs and spirals; dense-media cyclones; flotation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: acid leaching; magnetic separation; ultrafine grinding; chemical bleaching
Key Remediation Technologies: filtered tailings; paste backfill; water treatment; progressive rehabilitation
Bottleneck: Quality ore import reliance

Bottleneck Explainer: High electricity costs limit Si metal output vs. demand growth. https://pubs.usgs.gov/periodicals/mcs2024/mcs2024-silicon.pdf
Key Discovery Technologies: Geological mapping; hyperspectral imaging; geochemical assays; airborne geophysics; core drilling
Key Extraction Technologies: Open-pit quarrying; hydraulic mining; multi-stage crushing; washing/screening; selective mining
Key Separation Technologies: Gravity tapping; slag separation; dust collection; magnetic separation; density separation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Siemens process; fluidized bed reactor; directional solidification; metallurgical refining; upgraded metallurgical-grade process
Key Remediation Technologies: Baghouse filtration; wet scrubbing; water treatment; tailings management; dust suppression; carbon capture
Bottleneck: High-temperature arc furnaces; polysilicon refining capacity; high-purity quartz sourcing

Bottleneck Explainer: The U.S. is 100% import reliant on manganese. All Mn ore and ferroalloy are imported (mainly from South Africa, Gabon, Australia). With no domestic deposits in production, any supply disruption abroad (or in proposed seabed nodule projects) leaves the U.S. without manganese.
Key Discovery Technologies: hyperspectral imaging; airborne geophysics; AI-driven targeting; geochemical vectoring
Key Extraction Technologies: open-pit mining; in-pit crushing; ore sorting; selective mining
Key Separation Technologies: gravity concentration; magnetic separation; dense media separation; flotation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: reductive roasting; acid leaching; solvent extraction; electrowinning; crystallization
Key Remediation Technologies: passive treatment wetlands; manganese-oxidizing bioreactors; chemical precipitation; membrane filtration
Bottleneck: hydrometallurgical processing; battery-grade purification; domestic refining capacity

Bottleneck Explainer: Decade‑scale permitting/litigation delays limit new U.S. mines despite demand growth. https://www.futurity.org/copper-renewable-energy-electricity-3220892-2/
Key Discovery Technologies: Hyperspectral imaging; airborne geophysics; AI-driven data integration; 3D modeling
Key Extraction Technologies: Open-pit and block cave mining; SAG/ball milling; froth flotation; heap leaching
Key Separation Technologies: Froth flotation; solvent extraction; dense media separation; ore sorting
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Flash smelting; electrorefining; SX-EW; pressure oxidation
Key Remediation Technologies: Dry-stack tailings; water treatment; SO₂ capture; progressive rehabilitation
Bottleneck: Permitting timelines and capital constraints, not technology gaps

Bottleneck Explainer: Germanium is mostly obtained as a zinc smelting byproduct. The U.S. produces little Ge (about 50% import reliant), since domestic zinc smelting is minimal. Dependence on imports (from Canada, Belgium, China) and the byproduct nature of Ge constrain its availability.
Key Discovery Technologies: geochemical sampling of MVT/SEDEX deposits; XRF core scanning; EM geophysics; historical data mining
Key Extraction Technologies: roasting at 950-1000°C; two-stage acid leaching; ion exchange recovery; HF leaching for residues
Key Separation Technologies: solvent extraction with chelating agents; anion exchange resins; chlorination-volatilization; controlled precipitation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: hydrogen reduction at 650-750°C; zone refining to 6N purity; Czochralski crystal growth; vacuum distillation
Key Remediation Technologies: e-waste chemical recycling; phytoremediation with maize; tailings re-leaching; ion exchange wastewater treatment
Bottleneck: incomplete extraction from zinc residues; limited refining capacity; lack of chlorination-distillation infrastructure

Bottleneck Explainer: Gadolinium, a heavy rare earth, is not produced in the U.S. It is obtained from Chinese rare earth operations. The supply bottleneck is the lack of any domestic HREE production or processing, forcing 100% reliance on Chinese exports.
Key Discovery Technologies: Radiometric surveys; geochemical sampling; airborne geophysics; marine exploration
Key Extraction Technologies: Open-pit/underground mining; crushing/grinding; gravity separation; froth flotation
Key Separation Technologies: Solvent extraction cascades; ion exchange; fractional precipitation; membrane separation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Metallothermic reduction; molten salt electrolysis; vacuum refining; ultra-purification
Key Remediation Technologies: Tailings reprocessing; acid neutralization; water treatment; radioactive waste management
Bottleneck: Hydrometallurgical separation (SX/ion-exchange); specialized reagents; technical expertise

Bottleneck Explainer: The U.S. has no active tungsten mines (last closed in the 1990s), so it relies on imports for ~50% of needs (the rest comes from recycling or stockpiles). China is the world’s top tungsten producer. The absence of domestic mine supply makes tungsten a critical bottleneck for U.S. industry.
Key Discovery Technologies: UV-fluorescence mapping; aerial radiometric surveys; geochemical sampling; hyperspectral imaging
Key Extraction Technologies: open-pit/underground mining; drill-and-blast; crushing to <5mm; SAG/ball milling
Key Separation Technologies: dense-media separation; gravity tables/jigs; magnetic separation; froth flotation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: alkaline digestion to APT; hydrogen reduction to metal; carbothermic reduction to ferrotungsten
Key Remediation Technologies: tailings reprocessing; hydrometallurgical extraction; water treatment; phytostabilization
Bottleneck: APT/powder plants; hydrogen reduction furnaces; ferrotungsten smelters

Bottleneck Explainer: Only one U.S. producer (Utah) supplies magnesium metal, covering ~50% of domestic needs; the rest is imported. U.S. smelters struggle with high energy costs and environmental regulations. Over 50% of global Mg comes from China, making cost-competitive domestic expansion difficult (a supply bottleneck).
Key Discovery Technologies: Geochemical mapping; hyperspectral imaging; gravity surveys; brine analysis; waste assessment
Key Extraction Technologies: Pidgeon thermal reduction; electrolysis; aluminothermic; novel molten salt methods
Key Separation Technologies: Vapor condensation; vacuum separation; slag removal; crystallization; centrifugation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Vacuum distillation; flux refining; zone refining; sublimation; electrolytic polishing
Key Remediation Technologies: pH neutralization; slag recycling; gas scrubbing; dust control; brine management
Bottleneck: Low-carbon primary reduction; renewable electrolysis; energy-intensive processing

Bottleneck Explainer: Hafnium is only produced as a byproduct of zirconium refining, which itself is limited. U.S. hafnium output depends on domestic zircon processing (small) and imports. Any decline in zirconium production directly tightens Hf supply. Lack of primary Hf sources is the bottleneck.
Key Discovery Technologies: radiometric surveys; geochemical sampling; heavy-mineral mapping; exploration drilling
Key Extraction Technologies: open-pit/dredge mining; spiral concentrators; magnetic separation; wet concentration
Key Separation Technologies: solvent extraction; chloride distillation; molten salt electrolysis
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Kroll reduction; vacuum arc melting; electron beam melting; zone refining
Key Remediation Technologies: monazite/thorium management; tailings dry stacking; dust suppression; water treatment
Bottleneck: Zr-Hf chemical separation; limited feedstock access; regulatory barriers

Bottleneck Explainer: Thulium is one of the rarest rare earths, produced only in minute quantities in China. With no U.S. production, all Tm must be imported (if available at all). The incredibly low supply (and sole Chinese source) make Tm supply essentially bottlenecked by its rarity and China's output.
Key Discovery Technologies: Airborne radiometrics; XRF geochemistry; carbonatite mapping; ion-adsorption clay detection
Key Extraction Technologies: Gravity/magnetic separation; sulfuric acid leaching; solvent extraction; ion exchange
Key Separation Technologies: Multi-stage solvent extraction; supported liquid membranes; chromatography; fractional crystallization
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Metallothermic reduction; vacuum distillation; zone refining; electrolytic refining
Key Remediation Technologies: Tailings reprocessing; acid neutralization; radioactive element removal; water treatment
Bottleneck: Multi-stage solvent extraction for heavy REE separation; hydrometallurgical processing infrastructure

Bottleneck Explainer: Domestic mines supply <20%; majority from imports despite recycling. https://pubs.usgs.gov/periodicals/mcs2024/mcs2024-silver.pdf
Key Discovery Technologies: Geochemical sampling; airborne geophysics; hyperspectral imaging; machine learning targeting
Key Extraction Technologies: Flotation concentration; cyanide leaching; pressure oxidation; bioleaching
Key Separation Technologies: Merrill-Crowe precipitation; electrowinning; ion exchange; solvent extraction
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Electrolytic refining; Miller process; vacuum distillation; zone refining
Key Remediation Technologies: Lime neutralization; sulfide precipitation; membrane filtration; phytoremediation
Bottleneck: Low-grade byproduct recovery; lack of primary silver deposits

Bottleneck Explainer: U.S. cobalt output is minimal (mainly a byproduct of copper mining), covering only ~2% of demand. Over 95% is imported or refined overseas. The supply chain depends on the D.R. Congo for mining and China for refining, making U.S. supply vulnerable to foreign disruptions.
Key Discovery Technologies: Geophysical surveys (magnetic/EM); geochemical sampling; radiometric surveys; machine learning integration; 3D drilling/imaging
Key Extraction Technologies: Sulfide flotation; pressure acid leaching (HPAL); ammoniacal leaching; bio-oxidation (R&D); roasting/calcination
Key Separation Technologies: Solvent extraction (SX); ion exchange; precipitation/crystallization; electrowinning
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Chemical purification to battery-grade; electrowinning to metal; battery-salt synthesis; electrochemical recycling
Key Remediation Technologies: Neutralization/precipitation; phytoremediation; adsorption/filtration; tailings containment
Bottleneck: Refining capacity; economic viability; permitting delays

Bottleneck Explainer: Neodymium (for magnets) is produced at Mountain Pass in a concentrate, but must be refined abroad (China). Lack of U.S. separation and magnet alloy manufacturing is the bottleneck. Thus, U.S. magnet supply chains depend on foreign Nd-Pr metal production.
Key Discovery Technologies: Radiometric surveys; geochemical sampling; geophysical mapping; remote sensing; biogeochemical indicators
Key Extraction Technologies: Open-pit mining; physical beneficiation; hydrometallurgical leaching; precipitation; ion-exchange for clays
Key Separation Technologies: Solvent extraction; ion-exchange chromatography; selective oxidation; fractional crystallization
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Metallothermic reduction; molten salt electrolysis; vacuum refining; alloying; magnet fabrication
Key Remediation Technologies: Neutralization/precipitation; constructed wetlands; tailings reprocessing; adsorption; radioactive waste management
Bottleneck: Hydrometallurgical separation (solvent extraction) and rare-earth metallurgy capacity

Bottleneck Explainer: The U.S. mines a lot of zinc (e.g., Red Dog in Alaska) but has almost no smelting—its last primary zinc smelter closed in 2013. Concentrates are exported and metal is imported. Thus, domestic zinc metal supply is bottlenecked by the lack of refining capacity, making the U.S. ~80% import reliant for refined zinc.
Key Discovery Technologies: Geochemical mapping; IP surveys for sulfides; EM for massive sulfides; gravity/magnetics; diamond drilling
Key Extraction Technologies: Open-pit for near-surface deposits; underground stoping methods; automated mining systems
Key Separation Technologies: Froth flotation for sulfides; gravity separation; oxide ore treatment; modern reagent systems
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Roast-leach-electrowin (RLE); pressure leaching; solvent extraction; electrowinning to 99.995% purity
Key Remediation Technologies: Lime neutralization; high-density sludge; passive wetlands; permeable barriers; metal recovery
Bottleneck: Lack of domestic zinc smelting/refining capacity; limited exploration investment; declining ore grades

Bottleneck Explainer: The U.S. has no yttrium production (100% import reliant, mainly from China). Yttrium is obtained from ion-adsorption clays and other rare earth deposits in China. Without domestic production, the bottleneck is absolute import dependence on Chinese sources.
Key Discovery Technologies: Airborne geophysics; geochemical sampling; hyperspectral imaging; machine learning prospectivity mapping
Key Extraction Technologies: Open-pit mining; crushing/grinding; gravity separation; magnetic separation; flotation
Key Separation Technologies: Solvent extraction cascades; ion exchange chromatography; selective precipitation; membrane separation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Zone refining; vacuum melting; chemical vapor transport; powder metallurgy
Key Remediation Technologies: Radioactive waste management; water treatment; acid neutralization; progressive rehabilitation
Bottleneck: Solvent extraction and hydrometallurgical separation capacity

Bottleneck Explainer: No primary vanadium mines operate in the U.S. Vanadium is recovered from byproducts like oil refining residues or imported slag. This limited secondary production (~3 kt projected) falls short of demand, keeping the U.S. import-reliant. Dependence on foreign sources (e.g., Russia, South Africa) for vanadium-bearing materials is the bottleneck.
Key Discovery Technologies: Radiometric surveys; aeromagnetic surveys; geochemical sampling; geological mapping; drilling programs
Key Extraction Technologies: Alkaline roast-leach; smelting/slag processing; acid leaching; direct reduction; byproduct recovery
Key Separation Technologies: Solvent extraction; ion exchange; pH precipitation; crystallization; membrane separation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Calcination to V₂O₅; vacuum refining; ferrovanadium production; chemical conversion; ultra-purification
Key Remediation Technologies: Chemical precipitation; adsorption systems; phytoremediation; oxidation processes; waste recycling
Bottleneck: Processing infrastructure; ore beneficiation; purification capacity; environmental compliance

Bottleneck Explainer: The U.S. mines lanthanum-rich rare earth ore (Mountain Pass) but has limited domestic refining. Separated La is mostly processed in China. Although La itself is abundant, the need to ship concentrate abroad for refining is a bottleneck in fully independent supply.
Key Discovery Technologies: Radiometric surveys; hyperspectral imaging; geochemical sampling; magnetic/gravity surveys
Key Extraction Technologies: Open-pit mining; crushing/grinding; froth flotation; gravity separation; magnetic separation
Key Separation Technologies: Solvent extraction; ion exchange; selective precipitation; fractional crystallization
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Metallothermic reduction; molten salt electrolysis; vacuum distillation; zone refining
Key Remediation Technologies: Radioactive waste management; water treatment/recycling; tailings stabilization; dust control
Bottleneck: Solvent extraction separation; hydrometallurgical processing; waste management infrastructure

Bottleneck Explainer: Praseodymium is mined with neodymium at Mountain Pass, but the mixed Nd-Pr product must be separated and converted to metal/magnets overseas. The absence of domestic praseodymium refining and magnet manufacturing is the bottleneck for this critical magnet metal.
Key Discovery Technologies: Radiometric surveys; hyperspectral imaging; geochemical sampling; magnetic/gravity surveys
Key Extraction Technologies: Flotation concentration; acid/alkaline leaching; roasting; heap/in-situ leaching
Key Separation Technologies: Multi-stage solvent extraction; ion exchange chromatography; selective precipitation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Oxide calcination; metallothermic reduction; powder metallurgy; zone refining
Key Remediation Technologies: Magnet recycling; tailings neutralization; phytoremediation; closed-loop processing
Bottleneck: Solvent extraction and ion exchange separation capacity

Bottleneck Explainer: The U.S. has zero chromium ore mining, relying completely on imports for chromite/ferrochrome. This total import dependence (mainly on South Africa, Kazakhstan, etc.) is a major supply bottleneck, posing strategic vulnerability.
Key Discovery Technologies: Ultramafic mapping; airborne gravity/magnetics; hyperspectral imaging; geochemical AI screening
Key Extraction Technologies: Underground drift-and-fill; automated drilling; conveyor hoisting; HPGR crushing
Key Separation Technologies: Dense-medium separation; spirals; shaking tables; magnetic separation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Submerged-arc ferrochrome smelting; aluminothermic reduction; molten salt electrolysis
Key Remediation Technologies: Tailings stabilization; Cr(VI) reduction; phytoremediation; water treatment
Bottleneck: Ferrochrome smelting capacity; direct reduction of chromite; low-carbon processing

Bottleneck Explainer: The U.S. has 0 natural graphite mining and is 100% import reliant. With China controlling the majority of graphite production and purification, U.S. battery-grade graphite supply is a major bottleneck. Developing domestic mines or synthetic graphite capacity is needed.
Key Discovery Technologies: airborne electromagnetics; magnetic surveys; resistivity/IP; geochemical sampling
Key Extraction Technologies: open-pit mining; selective blasting; ore sorting; electric equipment
Key Separation Technologies: froth flotation; gravity separation; magnetic separation; screening/classification
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: thermal purification; chemical leaching; spheroidization; carbon coating
Key Remediation Technologies: water treatment; tailings management; dust control; progressive rehabilitation
Bottleneck: purification infrastructure; spherical graphite coating; high-temperature graphitization furnaces

Bottleneck Explainer: The U.S. has had zero primary antimony mine production for decades, making it ~85% import reliant. Supply depends on foreign sources (mainly China), and processing capacity is limited, causing a critical bottleneck.
Key Discovery Technologies: Geochemical mapping; IP/resistivity surveys; hyperspectral imaging; stream sediment analysis
Key Extraction Technologies: Underground mining; flotation concentration; gravity separation; roasting
Key Separation Technologies: Oxidative roasting; carbothermic reduction; electrolytic refining; vacuum distillation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Pressure leaching; zone refining; vacuum distillation; electrolytic purification
Key Remediation Technologies: Lime neutralization; constructed wetlands; iron-based adsorbents; phytostabilization
Bottleneck: Refining/smelting infrastructure; roasting furnaces; reduction technology; vacuum distillation

Bottleneck Explainer: Like other heavy rare earths, erbium has no U.S. source. All Er supply comes from Chinese mines, making the U.S. 100% import dependent. The bottleneck is the lack of any non-Chinese production or separation capacity for Er.
Key Discovery Technologies: airborne radiometrics; ICP-MS geochemistry; hyperspectral imaging; AI-driven targeting
Key Extraction Technologies: conventional open-pit; flotation beneficiation; acid/alkaline cracking; solvent extraction
Key Separation Technologies: multi-stage solvent extraction; ion exchange chromatography; selective precipitation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: oxalate precipitation; high-temperature calcination; metallothermic reduction; zone refining
Key Remediation Technologies: dry-stack tailings; acid neutralization; zero liquid discharge; radiometric monitoring
Bottleneck: China HREE monopoly

Bottleneck Explainer: The U.S. has no primary indium production (100% import reliant). Indium is recovered from zinc ores, but the U.S. lacks active zinc smelters to extract it. This means all indium for LCDs and semiconductors must be imported, a significant bottleneck.
Key Discovery Technologies: Multi-element geochemistry; zinc-tin deposit targeting; IP/EM geophysics; LA-ICP-MS analysis
Key Extraction Technologies: Roast-leach-electrowin from zinc; chloride volatilization; pressure oxidation; bioleaching
Key Separation Technologies: Solvent extraction with D2EHPA; ion exchange; selective precipitation; cementation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Vacuum distillation; electrolytic refining; zone melting; chemical vapor transport
Key Remediation Technologies: Jarosite reprocessing; ITO glass recycling; e-waste recovery; effluent treatment
Bottleneck: Byproduct recovery from zinc residues; ITO recycling infrastructure; specialized refining capacity

Bottleneck Explainer: U.S. nickel production is a fraction of demand (~17 kt vs 100 kt). Over 80% is imported. Moreover, global nickel supply is increasingly concentrated in Indonesia (under Chinese influence). The U.S. lacks sulfide reserves and processing for battery-grade nickel, creating a critical supply bottleneck.
Key Discovery Technologies: airborne electromagnetics; geochemical sampling; magnetic surveys; seismic imaging
Key Extraction Technologies: sulfide flotation; RKEF smelting; HPAL; heap leaching
Key Separation Technologies: solvent extraction; ion exchange; selective precipitation; crystallization
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: electrowinning; carbonyl refining; hydrogen reduction; sulfate crystallization
Key Remediation Technologies: acid neutralization; metal precipitation; tailings management; phytoremediation
Bottleneck: HPAL processing; battery-grade refining; sulfide ore beneficiation

Bottleneck Explainer: The U.S. is 100% reliant on imported fluorspar. Despite significant demand for acid-grade fluorspar (e.g. for fluorochemicals), there are no active U.S. fluorspar mines. This complete import dependence (mainly from Mexico) is the critical bottleneck.
Key Discovery Technologies: hyperspectral remote sensing; portable XRF geochemistry; induced polarization; machine learning targeting
Key Extraction Technologies: open-pit for shallow deposits; underground room-and-pillar; selective mining; ore sorting
Key Separation Technologies: crushing to -50mm; grinding to 65-100 mesh; froth flotation; gravity pre-concentration
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: HF production via H₂SO₄ reaction; multi-stage distillation; synthetic cryolite production; ultra-purification
Key Remediation Technologies: lime precipitation for fluoride removal; activated alumina adsorption; membrane filtration; tailings encapsulation
Bottleneck: HF production plants; acid-grade beneficiation; environmental permitting

Bottleneck Explainer: Recovery tied to Mo/Cu smelters; limited domestic anode‑slimes capture. https://pubs.usgs.gov/periodicals/mcs2024/mcs2024-rhenium.pdf
Key Discovery Technologies: porphyry copper-molybdenum exploration; molybdenite geochemistry; airborne geophysics; ICP-MS analysis
Key Extraction Technologies: molybdenite roasting with stack gas capture; pressure oxidation leaching; flue dust recovery
Key Separation Technologies: ammonium perrhenate precipitation; ion exchange resins; solvent extraction with amines
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: hydrogen reduction at 1000°C; powder metallurgy; electron beam melting; zone refining
Key Remediation Technologies: biosorption with microorganisms; chemical precipitation; electrochemical reduction; phytoremediation
Bottleneck: Byproduct recovery

Bottleneck Explainer: The U.S. has no tantalum mining and is fully reliant on imports. Most Ta is sourced from Central Africa or Brazil. With no domestic production or processing, any supply chain issue abroad directly threatens U.S. access to tantalum (used in capacitors), a clear bottleneck.
Key Discovery Technologies: LCT pegmatite mapping; geochemical vectoring; indicator minerals; airborne radiometrics
Key Extraction Technologies: Crushing/grinding; gravity concentration; magnetic separation; ore sorting
Key Separation Technologies: HF acid digestion; solvent extraction; ion exchange; precipitation methods
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Sodium reduction; electron-beam melting; powder metallurgy; CVD/ALD deposition
Key Remediation Technologies: Acid neutralization; fluoride precipitation; tailings management; dust control
Bottleneck: Hydrometallurgical refining capacity; HF-based solvent extraction; by-product recovery optimization

Bottleneck Explainer: Holmium (a heavy REE) has no U.S. source. It is only produced in China as a minor byproduct of rare earth separation. Thus the U.S. supply of Ho is entirely import-dependent, with availability constrained by Chinese production.
Key Discovery Technologies: Radiometric surveys; XRF geochemistry; hyperspectral imaging; AI-guided exploration
Key Extraction Technologies: Beneficiation; acid leaching; caustic cracking; ion-exchange leaching
Key Separation Technologies: Solvent extraction; ion exchange chromatography; fractional crystallization
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Calcination; metallothermic reduction; zone refining; vacuum distillation
Key Remediation Technologies: Radioactive waste management; water treatment; tailings stabilization
Bottleneck: Heavy REE separation infrastructure; solvent extraction cascades

Bottleneck Explainer: U.S. lacks primary Pb smelters; relies on exports of concentrate and domestic recycling. https://pubs.usgs.gov/periodicals/mcs2024/mcs2024-lead.pdf
Key Discovery Technologies: Geological mapping of carbonate terranes; geochemical soil surveys; airborne EM/gravity; ground IP/resistivity
Key Extraction Technologies: Underground drift-and-fill; open-pit bulk mining; gravity pre-concentration; flotation tailings recycling
Key Separation Technologies: Ball mill grinding; xanthate froth flotation; gravity tables; sequential Pb-Zn separation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Blast/KIVCET smelting; SO₂ capture; Betts electrolytic refining; battery scrap recycling
Key Remediation Technologies: Phosphate stabilization; phytoremediation with mustard/sunflower; microbial precipitation; soil capping
Bottleneck: Limited ore resources; aging smelter infrastructure; lack of new extraction technology

Bottleneck Explainer: Despite large lithium demand growth, U.S. production is limited to one brine operation (~5 kt). New projects (brines, clays) face lengthy development and permitting. The U.S. will remain heavily import-reliant for lithium chemicals through 2030, making project development pace the key bottleneck.
Key Discovery Technologies: MT/gravity geophysics for brines; magnetic/radiometric for pegmatites; geochemical sampling; remote sensing
Key Extraction Technologies: Open-pit mining for hard rock; brine pumping/evaporation; DLE adsorption/ion-exchange; clay heap leaching
Key Separation Technologies: Ion-exchange resins; solvent extraction; membrane separation; selective precipitation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Spodumene roasting/conversion; carbonate precipitation; hydroxide crystallization; ion-exchange polishing
Key Remediation Technologies: Membrane water recovery; chemical neutralization; tailings management; brine reinjection
Bottleneck: Industrial-scale lithium chemical refining capacity; proven DLE at commercial scale

Bottleneck Explainer: No primary bismuth is mined in the U.S.; supply is a byproduct of lead/zinc smelting abroad. With domestic lead smelting declining, the U.S. relies on imports (about 89% import reliant), mainly from China, so availability hinges on foreign lead production.
Key Discovery Technologies: Polymetallic skarn targeting; multi-element geochemistry; hyperspectral remote sensing; machine learning integration
Key Extraction Technologies: Selective flotation; pressure oxidation; bioleaching; gravity pre-concentration
Key Separation Technologies: Solvent extraction with D2EHPA/TBP; ion exchange resins; selective precipitation; membrane separation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Vacuum distillation; zone refining; electrorefining; chemical purification
Key Remediation Technologies: Precipitation/stabilization; adsorption on modified materials; electrochemical recovery; constructed wetlands
Bottleneck: Lack of dedicated bismuth recovery circuits in base-metal smelters; absence of hydrometallurgical separation infrastructure

Bottleneck Explainer: The U.S. has had no tin mines for decades, making it 100% import dependent for tin. Global tin production is concentrated in countries like Indonesia, Myanmar, and Peru. U.S. supply is vulnerable to disruptions in those regions, with no domestic fallback, hence a critical bottleneck.
Key Discovery Technologies: Geochemical pathfinders; IP/resistivity surveys; hyperspectral imaging; 3D modeling
Key Extraction Technologies: Underground mining; alluvial dredging; tailings reprocessing; in-situ recovery trials
Key Separation Technologies: Gravity spirals/jigs; flotation with specialized collectors; magnetic separation; ore sorting
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Reverberatory smelting; vacuum distillation; electrorefining; fuming furnaces
Key Remediation Technologies: Cement stabilization; arsenic precipitation; phytoremediation; passive treatment systems
Bottleneck: Resource availability; lack of domestic ore deposits; limited recycling infrastructure

Bottleneck Explainer: Cerium is produced at Mountain Pass, but the U.S. lacks domestic separation facilities for rare earths. Concentrates are sent overseas (primarily China) for processing. Thus, refining capacity—not mining—is the bottleneck for cerium supply.
Key Discovery Technologies: Radiometric surveys; geochemical mapping; airborne geophysics; stream sediment sampling
Key Extraction Technologies: Froth flotation; caustic roast-acid leach; direct acid leaching; solvent extraction
Key Separation Technologies: Oxidative precipitation; multi-stage solvent extraction; ion exchange chromatography
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Re-precipitation cycles; chlorination-electrolysis; metallothermic reduction
Key Remediation Technologies: Chemical precipitation; adsorption systems; membrane filtration; bioremediation
Bottleneck: High-volume cerium separation and stockpiling infrastructure

Bottleneck Explainer: U.S. leads in beryllium but production comes almost entirely from one company (Materion) at a single Utah mine—a single-point failure risk. This domestic monopoly limits supply resilience, as any disruption at this sole source could halt U.S. supply.
Key Discovery Technologies: Geological mapping of rhyolite tuffs; geochemical pathfinder surveys; hyperspectral remote sensing; core drilling
Key Extraction Technologies: Open-pit mining; crushing to -35 mesh; gravity preconcentration; multi-stage froth flotation; hand sorting of coarse beryl
Key Separation Technologies: Soda sintering at 770°C; sulfuric acid leaching; solvent extraction with naphthenates; hydroxide precipitation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Calcination to BeO; fluoride conversion; magnesiothermic reduction; vacuum arc remelting; precision alloying
Key Remediation Technologies: pH-controlled precipitation; activated carbon adsorption; biosorption; waste stabilization; HEPA dust control
Bottleneck: High-temperature chemical processing; toxic containment systems; specialized metallurgical reduction

Bottleneck Explainer: The U.S. produces some zircon (heavy mineral sands), but has limited capacity to refine it into zirconium chemicals or metal. Much of zirconium metal for nuclear and industrial use is imported. Reliance on foreign processing of zircon ore (and import of finished zirconium products) is the bottleneck in the supply chain.
Key Discovery Technologies: airborne radiometrics; heavy-mineral sampling; seismic surveys; satellite spectral analysis
Key Extraction Technologies: dredge mining; dry mining with MMUs; spiral concentrators; wet high-intensity magnetic separation
Key Separation Technologies: gravity spirals; magnetic separation; electrostatic separation; chloride distillation for Hf removal
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: vacuum arc remelting; electron beam melting; zone refining; crystal bar process
Key Remediation Technologies: water recycling; radioactive mineral management; progressive rehabilitation; dust suppression
Bottleneck: Zr/Hf separation; Kroll sponge production; chlorination infrastructure

Bottleneck Explainer: The U.S. produces mixed rare earth concentrates but does not separate europium domestically. All Eu (a mid-REE) supply comes via foreign separation facilities (chiefly China). The bottleneck is dependence on overseas processing to obtain Eu from mined rare earths.
Key Discovery Technologies: Radiometric surveys; XRF geochemistry; hyperspectral imaging; ionic clay assays
Key Extraction Technologies: Acid leaching; ion-exchange leaching; beneficiation; calcination
Key Separation Technologies: Solvent extraction; chromatography; selective reduction; fractional crystallization
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Molten salt electrolysis; vacuum distillation; zone refining; chemical vapor transport
Key Remediation Technologies: Tailings reprocessing; phosphor recycling; wastewater treatment; phytoremediation
Bottleneck: Solvent extraction capacity; separation expertise; low Eu ore grades

Bottleneck Explainer: Ample resources, but environmental/permitting constraints limit expansion. https://pubs.usgs.gov/periodicals/mcs2024/mcs2024-phosphate.pdf
Key Discovery Technologies: hyperspectral remote sensing; geochemical sampling; airborne geophysics; drilling & assaying
Key Extraction Technologies: open-pit mining; dragline excavation; underground room-and-pillar; hydraulic mining
Key Separation Technologies: froth flotation; gravity separation; screening & classification; desliming
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: wet-process phosphoric acid; impurity removal; fertilizer granulation; thermal process for high-purity
Key Remediation Technologies: mine reclamation; phosphogypsum management; water treatment; wetland restoration
Bottleneck: Environmental permitting

Bottleneck Explainer: Ytterbium, a heavy rare earth, is not mined in the U.S. All Yb supply is from Chinese rare earth operations. Thus the U.S. is entirely dependent on China for Yb, making the supply chain for this element extremely vulnerable.
Key Discovery Technologies: Radiometric surveys for Th/U; XRF core scanning; hyperspectral imaging; ionic clay assays
Key Extraction Technologies: Xenotime flotation; gravity spirals; magnetic separation; acid baking
Key Separation Technologies: 100+ stage solvent extraction; extractant optimization; continuous ion exchange; molecular recognition
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Metallothermic reduction; zone refining; sublimation purification; molten salt electrolysis
Key Remediation Technologies: Selective REE recovery from tailings; thorium immobilization; acid mine drainage prevention
Bottleneck: Heavy REE separation infrastructure; 100+ stage solvent extraction; dedicated Yb refining capacity

Bottleneck Explainer: No U.S. arsenic production (100% import reliant). Arsenic is obtained only as a smelter byproduct abroad, and its toxicity has led domestic producers to avoid its recovery, making the supply entirely dependent on imports.
Key Discovery Technologies: XRF geochemical surveys; IP geophysics for sulfides; hyperspectral remote sensing
Key Extraction Technologies: Flotation concentration; roasting at 500-700°C; alkaline/acid leaching
Key Separation Technologies: Baghouse/ESP collection; lime precipitation; iron co-precipitation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Sublimation at 613°C; carbon reduction; zone refining to 6N purity
Key Remediation Technologies: Phytoremediation with Pteris ferns; iron-based PRBs; stabilization/solidification
Bottleneck: Lack of primary ore deposits; absence of commercial byproduct recovery infrastructure

Bottleneck Explainer: U.S. produces scrap/flake mica; sheet‑grade for electronics is imported. https://pubs.usgs.gov/periodicals/mcs2024/mcs2024-mica.pdf
Key Discovery Technologies: airborne geophysics; hyperspectral imaging; geochemical vectoring; machine learning prospectivity mapping
Key Extraction Technologies: selective mining; controlled blasting; optical sorting; in-pit crushing
Key Separation Technologies: advanced flotation; electrostatic separation; air classification; optical sorting
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: chemical bleaching; surface modification; micronization; classification
Key Remediation Technologies: water recycling; dry stacking; progressive rehabilitation; dust suppression
Bottleneck: inefficient flotation recovery; lack of automated sheet extraction; fine particle losses

Bottleneck Explainer: U.S. lacks Se recovery from Cu anode slimes; imports meet demand. https://pubs.usgs.gov/periodicals/mcs2024/mcs2024-selenium.pdf
Key Discovery Technologies: geochemical sampling; electromagnetic surveys; XRF/LIBS field analysis; selenide mineral microscopy
Key Extraction Technologies: soda-ash roasting; sulfuric acid roasting; direct acid leaching; SO₂ reduction
Key Separation Technologies: selective precipitation; ion exchange; solvent extraction; membrane separation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: vacuum distillation; zone refining; fractional crystallization; chemical purification
Key Remediation Technologies: biological reduction; constructed wetlands; adsorption media; chemical precipitation
Bottleneck: copper anode slime recovery infrastructure; integrated selenium extraction circuits

Bottleneck Explainer: U.S. has no primary bauxite production; 100% import reliant into 2030. https://pubs.usgs.gov/periodicals/mcs2024/mcs2024-bauxite.pdf
Key Discovery Technologies: hyperspectral imaging; LiDAR terrain mapping; geochemical sampling; satellite remote sensing
Key Extraction Technologies: open-pit strip mining; hydraulic excavators; autonomous haulage; minimal blasting
Key Separation Technologies: crushing/screening; washing/scrubbing; magnetic separation; ore blending
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Bayer process for alumina; Hall-Héroult electrolysis; caustic recovery; energy optimization
Key Remediation Technologies: red mud neutralization; dry stacking; progressive rehabilitation; water recycling
Bottleneck: geological scarcity; Bayer process energy intensity; red mud management; logistics infrastructure

Bottleneck Explainer: Domestic feldspar covers ~50%; nepheline syenite imports from Canada fill the gap. https://pubs.usgs.gov/periodicals/mcs2024/mcs2024-feldspar.pdf
Key Discovery Technologies: hyperspectral imaging; geochemical mapping; airborne geophysics; machine learning integration
Key Extraction Technologies: open-pit quarrying; drilling and blasting; crushing circuits; conveyor systems
Key Separation Technologies: froth flotation; magnetic separation; gravity concentration; optical sorting
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: acid leaching; attrition scrubbing; size classification; chemical treatment
Key Remediation Technologies: tailings management; water treatment; dust control; mine closure
Bottleneck: HF/acid flotation circuits; limited high-grade deposits; aging processing infrastructure

Bottleneck Explainer: Cadmium is only recovered as a zinc‑smelting byproduct; limited U.S. smelting constrains supply. https://pubs.usgs.gov/periodicals/mcs2024/mcs2024-cadmium.pdf
Key Discovery Technologies: Geochemical mapping for Zn-Pb deposits; EM/IP geophysics; hyperspectral imaging; tailings resampling
Key Extraction Technologies: Zinc smelter byproduct recovery; battery scrap acid leaching; pyrometallurgical distillation; ion-exchange; electrowinning
Key Separation Technologies: pH-controlled precipitation; ion-exchange resins; electrowinning; flotation; solvent extraction
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Vacuum distillation; zone refining; electrolytic purification; chemical precipitation
Key Remediation Technologies: Phytoremediation with hyperaccumulators; soil immobilization; electrokinetics; adsorption; recycling
Bottleneck: Lack of primary resources; inefficient byproduct recovery from zinc refining; limited battery recycling capacity

Bottleneck Explainer: U.S. strontium mining ceased; 100% import reliant (mainly Mexico). https://pubs.usgs.gov/periodicals/mcs2024/mcs2024-strontium.pdf
Key Discovery Technologies: Geologic mapping of evaporites; gravity/magnetic surveys; geochemical soil sampling; core drilling
Key Extraction Technologies: Open-pit mining; potential dredging; byproduct recovery from zinc/barite; solution mining R&D
Key Separation Technologies: Dense media separation; gravity concentration; flotation; screening/classification
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Sodium carbonate roasting; carbothermic reduction; acid dissolution/crystallization; calcination
Key Remediation Technologies: Mineral pre-concentration; precipitation/ion exchange for wastewater; tailings management; phytoremediation research
Bottleneck: Lack of domestic ore deposits; absence of chemical conversion facilities; need for dense-media separation and high-temperature processing

Bottleneck Explainer: Tellurium is only produced as a copper refining byproduct. U.S. output is small (Kennecott Utah began Te recovery ~20 t/year). However, over 90% of Te comes from foreign copper anode slimes. If copper producers do not recover tellurium, or if imports from major producers (e.g. China) falter, tellurium supply is constrained.
Key Discovery Technologies: Copper-gold deposit analysis; anode slime assaying; hyperspectral imaging; tailings reprocessing
Key Extraction Technologies: Copper anode slime roasting; chlorination circuits; vacuum distillation; hydrometallurgical leaching
Key Separation Technologies: Selective precipitation; solvent extraction; ion exchange; fractional crystallization
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Zone refining; vacuum distillation; electrolytic refining; chemical recrystallization
Key Remediation Technologies: CdTe module recycling; tailings reprocessing; wastewater precipitation; emissions scrubbing
Bottleneck: Copper refinery Te recovery circuits; anode slime processing; chlorination/roasting infrastructure

Bottleneck Explainer: There are no active cesium mines in the U.S. or anywhere (0 production). Global cesium comes from a few small deposits (e.g., in Canada), and the U.S. must import or draw from stockpiles. The extreme scarcity of pollucite ore is the supply bottleneck.
Key Discovery Technologies: LCT pegmatite mapping; geochemical anomaly detection; indicator mineral chemistry; airborne geophysics
Key Extraction Technologies: XRT ore sorting; alkaline roasting; acid leaching; pressure leaching
Key Separation Technologies: Permanganate precipitation; ion exchange; solvent extraction; fractional crystallization
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Recrystallization; zone refining; vacuum distillation; electrolytic reduction
Key Remediation Technologies: Alkaline neutralization; zeolite adsorption; Prussian blue precipitation; vitrification
Bottleneck: Pollucite ore processing; multi-step chemical extraction; selective separation

Bottleneck Explainer: Rubidium has no mine production in the U.S. or elsewhere currently; it is obtained only in trace amounts as a byproduct of cesium or lithium processing. With the U.S. 100% import reliant (mainly on minor Canadian or other sources), rubidium availability is highly limited.
Key Discovery Technologies: LCT pegmatite mapping; ICP-MS geochemical surveys; XRF mineralogy; hyperspectral imaging
Key Extraction Technologies: Acid leaching; ion-exchange separation; brine crystallization; byproduct recovery
Key Separation Technologies: Selective resins; fractional crystallization; membrane separation; chelating agents
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Metal reduction; vacuum distillation; zone refining; recrystallization
Key Remediation Technologies: Water recycling; acid neutralization; tailings management; brine reinjection
Bottleneck: Ion-exchange separation; high-purity refining; byproduct recovery circuits

Bottleneck Explainer: There are no primary scandium mines in the U.S.; scandium is only recoverable as a byproduct (e.g., from Ti or REE operations). Domestic output is zero and even projected sources (from tailings) are small. This lack of dedicated production makes the U.S. entirely dependent on imports (from e.g. Australia) for Sc, a significant bottleneck.
Key Discovery Technologies: Radiometric surveys; geochemical mapping; magnetic/gravity surveys; stream sediment sampling
Key Extraction Technologies: HPAL; pyrometallurgical processing; solvent leaching from wastes; bioleaching
Key Separation Technologies: Solvent extraction; ion-exchange resins; selective precipitation; membrane separation
Key Purification & Refinement Technologi: Metallothermic reduction; electrolytic refining; Al-Sc master alloy production; vacuum arc melting
Key Remediation Technologies: Bioleaching; resin-in-pulp; biosorbents; membrane filtration; acid neutralization
Bottleneck: Ultra-low grade extraction; high energy costs; complex separation chemistry
